#BuildBackBetter puts strategies in place to address the root causes of the climate crisis on the same footing as those programs like crop insurance we count on to repair the damage from climate-related extreme weather.

Through the Agricultural Conservation Easement Program, #BuildBackBetter provides long term protection for wetlands, grasslands and farm and ranch lands, ensuring they can continue to build healthy soils and enhance water quality.
#BuildBackBetter invests in the Conservation Stewardship Program, which focuses on whole-farm conservation systems and rewards early-adopters of conservation practices.
#BuildBackBetter commits more for the Regional Conservation Partnerships Program at USDA, which leverages private and outside investments to support locally-led climate-smart agriculture projects

#BuildBackBetter increases funding for USDA’s EQIP program that helps farmers and ranchers implement and expand conservation practices like cover cropping, nutrient management and buffers that safeguard resources and sequester carbon in their soil and trees.

The #WomenVetsTaskForce thanks Mitchelene BigMan for her exceptional service to our country!

For her unwavering commitment to being a voice and advocate for Native American women veterans, BigMan has received national recognition and awards.  In addition to NAWW, BigMan serves on the advisory committee for the Smithsonian's National Native American Veterans Memorial. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FE6ZqwYXIAMjSRP.jpg

After her service, BigMan founded the Native American Women Warriors to bring attention to and honor the contributions of Native American women’s military service. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FE6ZQPmWQAMXgTH.jpg

BigMan served two tours in Iraq as an engineer equipment mechanic and platoon sergeant. Following over 20 years of service to our nation, BigMan retired with the rank of Sergeant First Class. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FE6ZNh_XEAIYBFL.jpg

BigMan often volunteered for missions to prove her capability to the male soldiers in her unit— and earned many accolades and commendations during her service, including a Combat Action Badge for surviving a mortar attack. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FE6ZnkwWYAA4LdZ.jpg

Mitchelene BigMan is an Army veteran and founder of Native American Women Warriors Organization (NAWW), the first ever recognized all Native American Women Color Guard. BigMan was born on the Crow Reservation in Montana and enlisted in the Army in 1986. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FE6ZI3kXsAEPPKj.jpg

Throughout #NativeAmericanHeritageMonth, the #WomensVetsTaskForce is celebrating the contributions of Native American #womenvets and their integral part to our nation – including Mitchelene BigMan. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FE6ZG4jXIAcGdg4.jpg
